column4: I downloaded the Ubuntu 12.10 amd64 iso so that I can upgrade my 12.04 to 12.10, but the live cd hangs at boot "Stopping save kernel messages [Ok]"
so i'm basically at the start :P
I already have 12.04 and wanted to upgrade the OS, but since that would require atleast 2gb of download, so i got the live cd and will upgrade using that
wastrel tried with unetbootin and the usb disc creator in ubuntu
by upgrade you mean clean installÂ¿
wastrel yes it doesnt boot, hangs at "Stopping Save kernel messages [Ok]"
i've too much installed to do a clean install :P
then you just need the iso, there wasn't need to create a bootable usb
and anyways you'll have to still upgrade all the programs that are not in the cd, those 2gb for upgrade didn't create on their own ;)
hahahah xangua indeed, but i was able to save atleast 800mb by getting the iso from office lol :P
cos my net sucks big time
you will not save nothing at the end, plenty of documetation since official to a lot of unoficial(blog) guides https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Upgrades#Upgrades_via_alternate_CD
